intro: Nasturtium portoricense, commonly known as the Portuguese nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Tropaeolaceae family and is characterized by its bright orange or yellow flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are edible and have a peppery taste, making it a popular ornamental and culinary plant. Nasturtium portoricense thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
